intro: Spermolepis castellanosii, commonly known as the Castellanos' broom, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, branched stems and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Spermolepis castellanosii is adapted to grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
